subject: Re: [PATCH v1] mm: zswap: add per-memcg stat for incompressible pages

reviews.author: Nhat Pham
reviews.summary: Reviewer Nhat Pham agrees with the patch, finding it useful for multi-tenant setups and suggesting potential improvements such as adding per-memcg counters to zswap compression levels. He also recommends updating the Documentation and suggests using /dev/urandom instead of reading zstd data.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Shakeel Butt, found the patch overall good but suggested a few changes, including updating the documentation and renaming the stat to something more descriptive like 'INCOMPRESSIBLE' or 'INCOMP'.

reviews.author: Yosry Ahmed
reviews.summary: Reviewer Yosry Ahmed suggested renaming several functions to better reflect their purpose and also proposed dropping a helper function.

reviews.author: Jiayuan Chen (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jiayuan Chen raised concerns about the correctness of using a helper function zswap_is_incomp() in mm/memcontrol.c, suggesting it would be semantically incorrect and instead proposed to use dlen == PAGE_SIZE to verify decompression output.

reviews.author: SeongJae Park
reviews.summary: Reviewer SeongJae Park raised concerns about the documentation of the new stat and suggested improvements to the zswap_is_raw() helper function, including renaming it for clarity.
